Class DiceGameDecomposed

  • java.lang.Object
    • DiceGameDecomposed

  • public class DiceGameDecomposed
extends java.lang.Object
    Problem: Considering the following dice game. n players (n >= 1) each roll once per round.

    Player 1 rolls a (fair) dodecahedron, having 12 faces with the numbers 1 through 12. The other players (2 through n) roll two fair dice, each having 6 faces with the numbers 1 through 6.

    The player with the unique highest roll wins the round. If the highest roll is not unique, then there is no round winner.

    Osipov Lev, 271(1), 17.09.2013

    • Method Detail

      • simulate

        public static int[] simulate(int n,
             int r)
        Simulates r >= 0 rounds of the dice game and returns how often each of n >= 1 players has won. The return value is an array, where index 0 counts the number of rounds without winner, and index i > 0 counts the number of rounds won by player i.
        Parameters:
        n - number of players
        r - number of rounds
        Returns:
        an array with numbers of wins of each player
        Precondition:
        r >= 0 && n >= 1

      • simulate1round

        static int simulate1round(int n)
        Simulates one round of the game for n players. Returns the winner of the round, or NO_WINNER if there is no winner.
        Parameters:
        n - number of players
        Returns:
        winner number
        Precondition:
        n >= 1
        Postcondition:
        0 <= /result <= n

      • getRolls

        static int[] getRolls(int n)
        Returns array with n rolls: the first player rolls a dodecahedron; the other players roll two dice. N.B. The roll of player 1 is returned at index 0.
        Parameters:
        n - number of players
        Returns:
        an array with rolls of each player
        Precondition:
        n >= 1
        Postcondition:
        (\forall int i; i < \result.length; 2 <= \result[i] <= 12) && 1 <= /result[0] <= 6

      • roll

        static int roll(int k)
        Rolls k-sided fair dice with values 1 through k.
        Parameters:
        k - number of dice sides
        Returns:
        result of rolling
        Precondition:
        k => 1
        Postcondition:
        1 <= /result <= k

      • getWinner

        static int getWinner(int[] rolls)
        Determine round winner, given the round rolls.
        Parameters:
        rolls - array of players rolls
        Returns:
        number of winner or NO_WINNER if there is no winner
        Postcondition:
        0 <= /return < rolls.length
